mdRecord.dcterms:description: The house and its surrounding farmland became the primary residence of Theodore and Edith Roosevelt for the rest of their lives and the birthplace of three of their five children. Sagamore Hill took on its greatest importance when it became known as the "Summer White House" during the seven summers (1902â€“1908) that Roosevelt spent there as President. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagamore_Hill_(house) [work]
